text: Passing control. The program counter must be set to the starting address of the code for Q upon entry and then set to the instruction in P following the call to Q upon return. Passing data. P must be able to provide one or more parameters to Q, and Q must be able to return a value back to P. Allocating and deallocating memory. Q may need to allocate space for local variables when it begins and then free that storage before it returns.
